name: elixir
subtitle: Elixir
about: Elixir is a functional, meta-programming aware language built on top of the Erlang VM. It is a dynamic language that focuses on tooling to leverage Erlang's abilities to build concurrent, distributed and fault-tolerant applications with hot code upgrades.

videos.title: How to install Elixir and Erlang
videos.description: How to install and manage Elixir and Erlang with kerl and exenv.

videos.title: IEx Run-Time System Flags
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about Elixir run-time system flags.

videos.title: Creating Local and Remote Shells
videos.description: In this episode you will learn how to create local and remote shells.

videos.title: IEx Helpers and Common Commands
videos.description: In this episode you will learn about IEx helpers and common commands.

videos.title: IEx Working with Files and Scripts
videos.description: In this episode you will learn how to work and manipulate files and scripts.

videos.title: Customizing IEx
videos.description: In this episode you will learn some tips about how to customize the IEx.

videos.title: Introduction and Installing Elixir
videos.description: A quick introduction to the screencast, followed by an Erlang / Elixir installation walkthrough.

videos.title: Dinamo Part 1
videos.description: The first part to an introduction to building a web application in Elixir using Dynamo.

videos.title: Releases with Relex
videos.description: Making your Elixir application redistributable using Erlang releases.

videos.title: PCM Audio
videos.description: Generating PCM Audio and making some noise.

videos.title: Ecto Part 1
videos.description: An introduction to using Ecto and Postgres for persistence.

videos.title: Parsing XML
videos.description: A glimpse into XML parsing in Elixir, by way of interoperating with an Erlang module.

videos.title: Maps Part 1
videos.description: An introduction to maps, a new feature in Erlang R17 and Elixir 0.13.

videos.title: Maps Part 2
videos.description: Introducing structs and demonstrating how they can take the place of public Records.

videos.title: Quickie Synth
videos.description: Using processes, gs, and shelling out to `sox` to build an Elixir-based synthesizer module.

videos.title: EEx
videos.description: Elixir's built-in templating language, useful for embedding Elixir code inside of a string.
